Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: Senior citizens are prime targets for several kinds of fraud.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: Here are a few to watch out for.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: After reading about a recent death,

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: the obituary con artist visits the spouse of a deceased person

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: and tells a convincing story about a debt incurred by the deceased,

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: often to purchase a gift for the survivor.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: Touched by the deceased person's thoughtfulness,

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: the survivor usually pays the bills.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: The con artist then either disappears with the money

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: the money or produces a gift that is greatly overpriced.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: Then there's the pigeon drop,

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: where con artists working in pairs can front a senior citizen

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: and claim they filed a large sum of money.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: They offer to share it with the individual.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: However, before the target can get it on a deal,

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: he has asked to put up some good faith money.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: If the person falls for the scheme,

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: of course the peer takes off with the victim's money.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: And you've probably heard about the voting bank

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: who asks for help in catching a dishonest bank employee.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: The target is usually a woman and is asked to withdraw cash from her account

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: and turn it over to the examiner,

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: who will then check the serial numbers and catch the event.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: After the money is turned over, the victim never saved her money

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: or the operator again.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: These are by no means the only con-games going around.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: As the operators are limited only by their own imagination.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: They are usually well-pest, film-light, and

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: intelligent, so don't be fooled by appearances and sincerity.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: If you have been victimized or approached about a transaction such as those described,

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: don't hesitate to call the police or your state or full consumer protection office.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: Using carefully prepared threats, swift phone solicitors try to entice businesses

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: into buying almost anything under the sun.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: Common sales pitches include advertising space and non-existent publications.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: applications, office supplies, and specialty advertising items like calendars or personalized pens.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: Funding prizes are used to offer to make the deals more attractive.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: And both the sales item and prize are delivered COD.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: So be careful.

Speaker: SPEAKER_00
Text: Don't buy from new suppliers and see to have verified their existence and reliability.
